column4: AMD and nVidia's binary drivers don't currently support switching to and from the Intel on-cpu video card, so you get stuck with the Intel video permanently.

I'm in the market for a new laptop and I'm hearing bad things about this onboard Intel video not playing nice with the binary drivers.  Machines with really good video cards getting stuck using the Intel video.
Your best bet would be radeon since they have very good open drivers
the open drivers are an option, but they don't compare to the binary ones
